That's why they changed the name to Forest Green.  People want to forget this was once Crystal Lake.  And they don't need some kid stirring up Jason shit again.

dialogues.text: He withdraws his weapon from the car and heads for his vi

dialogues.text: struggles to stand.  She slips, badly twisting or breakin her ankle.  Looking back quickly, she is horrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: with spear poised, he's coming!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Knowing it's hopeless to run, she tries a last-ditch effo to barter for her life.  Lying in the muddy water, Lizbet digs into her jacket.  She pulls out her wallet and remov her money and credit cards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (crying) Don't kill me, please.  You can have these.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks up and offers her valuables.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is amazed.  Where did he go?  What's the difference - she's safe.  WRONG.  As she looks behind her, JASON'S FEE SLAM DOWN IN THE WATER NEXT TO HER HEAD.  She opens her m to scream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He raises the spear and RAMS IT DOWN TOWARD HER FACE!  A spine-chilling CRUNCH is HEARD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason stands over his victim... Her body floats on the fi water, but her head is drive down underneath.  BLOOD begi to bubble up around the extended spear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lifeless hand releases the money and credit cards it wa clutching. We follow the floating American Express card along the no bloody stream... Remember, don't leave home without it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy is asleep on the cot in his cell.  Suddenly the LOU SOUNDS of the DOOR OPENING and YOUNG VOICES startle him a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Entering from the bright sunshine are the sheriff and fou kids in their late teens.  Teasing, holding on to the arm her sheriff father, is MEGAN.  She is a cute and feisty 1 year-old.  Her three friends, PAULA, a warm and personabl girl with a short new-wave haircut; SISSY is black, sexy very boy-crazy; and CORT, with his long hair and heavy me T-shirt, is always ready to rock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to sheriff) Come on, Dad.  You could have Rick drive down Cunningham Road and look for them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Megan, my deputies have more important things to do than look for camp counselors with car trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheriff, couldn't you like put our an all-points bulletin for them? That would be really wicked decent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sheriff shoots him a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just that Darren and Lizbeth are in charge of organizing and setting up the new campgrounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the little kids arrive today. We're not ready to deal with that alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sits down behind his desk and picks up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sympathize with you kids.  The best I can do is call the station in Carpenter and have them keep a lookout for them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a bad feeling of what might've happened to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone turns to look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is gripping the cell's bars.  His eyes connect with Megan

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got to convince the sheriff to look for your friends. Hopefully, they're fine.  But there's a very good chance that Jason...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: jumps up angrily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Megan, attracted to the good-looking prisoner, walks towa his cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ordering her) Megan, get away from him.  He's dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops a few feet from the cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sincerely) I'm not dangerous, believe me. Jason is out there.  He's looking for me.  But there's every possibility he'll return to the camp where it all started.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sheriff stomps over toward Tommy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (clenching his teeth) I told you to shut...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervously) You mean the Jason of Camp Blood?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!... (to kids) ... You kids better leave.  This boy here is not well and I need to talk to him in private.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, Dad, we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very firmly) Megan, take your friends back to the camp.  I'll let you know if I hear anything about your counselors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wants to argue, but the look in her father's eye tell her she'd better cool it.  She takes one more look at Tom as she approaches her father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wisecracking) Don't beat him up too bad, he's kinda cute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This really steams the sheriff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Megan, leave!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stumble out awkwardly as Megan struts away with a co Lauren Bacall swagger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the door is closed, the steely-eyed sheriff leans in c to Tommy's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was going to call the clinic and have them collect your ass.  But I don't want you around here any longer poisoning my daughter, or anyone else, with your warped mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (extremely concerned) But they have to be warned, Sheriff.  Jason will return to the area that's familiar.  No matter what you call it, it's still Camp Crystal Lake to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: walks away, not listening to Tommy.  He straps on his hol and puts on his coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deadly serious) We're gonna escort you and that shit-pile pickup of yours to the edge of my jurisdiction.... (he picks up his rifle) ....Then we'll say goodbye and we'll never see your deranged butt around here again... (he cocks rifle) ...Right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: pushes off the bars in frustration and paces the cell lik caged animal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large clump of thick bushes.  Someone's moving behind t We TRACK along, following the rustles.  It stops. We HOLD WAIT.  SUDDENLY THE BUSHES PART ABRUPTLY.  A bespectacled little man in Army fatigues and camouflage makeup pokes h head out at us.  ROY, wearing protective goggles, looks r left, then hides back in the brush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We follow TWO OTHER BUSINESSMEN decked out in green jungl fatigues, looking like out-of-shape Rambos.  STAN and LAR are both carrying handguns, watching for any movement aro them.  They, too, wear goggles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) Once we nail Roy, that's it. Victory is ours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is taking forever.  I'm starving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's your problem, Larry. That's why your sales are always below quota.  Your instinct to eat is stronger than your instinct to win.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (insulted) My ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's fat too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He watches motionlessly as the two arguing men pass.  The of course, don't see him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (outraged) You become a whole other person when you're out here, Stan.  And I don't like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (arrogant) This is a man's game.  Requiring a man's cunning and intelligence...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They react in terror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A goggle-wearing woman, also in Army fatigues, has her revolver pointed at them.  KATIE fires at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: are splattered by red-paint pellets.  Boy, are they pisse

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: grins triumphantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ....with a woman's touch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now wait a second!  I thought Burt shot you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turns all around) See any paint?... (cocky) ...Sorry, guys, I did in Mr. Commando.  Survival is the name of the game, and that flag is mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they walk away, Larry looks at his paint-smeared chest

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Stan) Never should've let her play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a damn company executive game, and she's a damn company exec.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (motherly) Now, now, boys.  Don't be spoilsports.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: silently watches.  He then heads for them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The freshly painted and beautifully renovated cabin retre gleams in the bright sunlight.  Even the lake itself shim tranquilly, free of any memories of its horrid past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Megan, Cort, Paula, and Sissy carry food supplies from th car to the cabin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm getting worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About Jason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...about Darren and Lizbeth. They should have at least called. Don't you think, Megan?...Megan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Megan's mind is definitely on something--or someone--else

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (breaking out of it) Huh?  Yeah, what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (giggles) This girl's back in the cell with her prisoner of love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Megan hits her playfully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's it to ya?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be playin' with no crazy jailbird.  Those dudes are bad news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?  How would you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been around long enough...to see plenty on TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone laughs or groans at Sissy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, Megan.  He seemed pretty weird with all that Jason stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, he was really into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (playing with them) Maybe he was telling the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone stops and stares at her in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (keeping the ruse going) Just because our parents keep telling us that Jason was only a legend, doesn't mean it wasn't true.  What if Jason did come back here... (dramatically) ...And you know what today's date is, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Each of their faces registers a different expression, wondering if Megan is serious or not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: looks past them at something, then smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slyly) I can think of only one thing even more terrifying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervously) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She points behind them.  They turn to look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: pulls up into the camp.  The doors fly open.  A group of screaming youngsters pile out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: stare in dread.  How are they gonna handle this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I'd rather deal with ol' Jason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MACHETE IS SEEN.  We follow the deadly weapon as it's carried through the woods.  Reaching some heavy brush, it hacks away at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BURT, a real Rambo/Commando clone in paint-splattered fatigues, whacks angrily at the brushes.  Of all the woul hunters, he looks like he takes the game almost too seriously.  He wears a commando belt loaded with a surviv knife, devil darts and his machete sheath.  Like his partners, he too is a sore loser.  As he hacks away, he mumbles curses about this "stupid game."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He raises the machete higher as he attacks the defenseles bushes.  SUDDENLY, A HORRIBLY DISFIGURED HAND GRABS HIS H STOPPING THE MACHETE IN MID-SWING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shocked, Burt whips around, and gasps at the masked Jason

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason's iron grip turns the hunter's hand with the machet toward his bug-eyed face.  Jason forces the helpless man stare at the weapon in his own hand that's about to take life.  He then PLUNGES the razor-sharp blade through his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt's corpse drops before us.  The gaping wound through throat bubbles out bloody air bubbles.  His eyes stare lifelessly at us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crusty old CARETAKER stares down in utter horror. His bloodshot, alcoholic eyes widen at what they see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shit.  Shit-SHIT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands over Jason's dug-up grave, cursing at what has happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taking out a pint of Whiskey from his coat, he takes a st slug and winces.  With hangover equilibrium, he paces, nervous and afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh-hh.  Why me?...I know he's gonna blame me for this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin looks around quickly.  He decides to cover up the grave.  He starts throwing all the evidence into the hole then, grabbing the shovel, begins filling it in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (become more frightened) Damn.  Why Jason?  Mothers could have their pick... (he gestures) ...of any of these other graves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shovel-loads of dirt and mud slam down on the coffin. Haw foot is seen sticking out of the casket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shitheads couldn't even stick him back in right.  Well, I ain't gonna touch the slimy sucker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's beginning to sweat as he works faster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can't find out.  He'll think I ain't doin' my job.  I need that money...He won't find out... (looking around fearfully) ...No one's gonna know...I need my money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy drives with incredible anxiety down the forest road He glances up into the rear-view mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheriff Garris and his deputy, Rick, are following close behind in their police car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keeping a stern eye on Tommy, the sheriff shakes his head

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to deputy) It's kinda frightening to think that a kid like that can go so far over the edge.  Jason really screwed up the poor sonofabitch's mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amazed) He really believes Jason's still alive, doesn't he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods and sighs) But that's no what worries me the most...It's how far he'll go to try and prove it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy's pickup, with the sheriff's car right on his tail, roars down the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roy has still not been found.  Hiding behind a tree, the little man with funny-shaped glasses watches for any unse assassins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In his ill-fighting fatigues, he dashes comically from be one tree to another.  His foot catches in some vines and takes a terrific pratfall.  The paint-pellet gun flies fr his hand and vanishes into the fallen leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He scrambles on his hands and knees to find his weapon. Panicking he'll be seen and shot, Roy starts to whimper a searches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly we MOVE toward the vulnerable little man with his to us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fire some time ago has blackened the trees and ground i this area.  Katie, Stan and Larry walk along, looking for their missing players.  Holding up the other team's flag victoriously, Katie hollers out:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, you guys!  The game's over!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disgruntled) You don't know for sure.  What about Roy?  Nobody's seen him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cocky) Of course not.  If he hasn't already accidentally pelleted himself, I'm sure he's lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but the game's not over until it's over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (going along) That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katie starts to counter, when she thinks she hears someth She stops them abruptly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shh-hh.  Wait a second.  What was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone freezes, listening very intently.  A LONG WAIT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All three stand stock-still, looking around and listening

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not hearing a thing, Stan relaxes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahh, nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loud whisper) I could swear I heard...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason wants to play army, too.  He quickly withdraws the machete from his newly acquired commando belt.  With one violent slice, the blade slashes their throats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The razor-sharp machete opens up all three throats almost simultaneously.  It happens so fast, they barely have tim even gasp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THREE HANDS DROP OFF, FOLLOWED BY COLLAPSING BODIES.  Jas watches them fall, then looks up at something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terrified beyond belief is Roy!  He stands a few yards aw in a small clearing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wastes no time as he stalks the final hunter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So incredibly frightened, he doesn't think as he raises h gun at Jason and fires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blood/red-paint pellet makes a direct hit on Jason's chest.  He stops and glances down at this annoying mess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he looks up at Roy, he is even more pissed off.  He LU for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: screams, drops the gun, and runs for his life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is hell-bent on catching this nerd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tears of terror are welling up as the poor guy races.  Ja is seen a short distance behind, machete poised and ready Roy glances back quickly, then screams as he heads throug the ugly charred forest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God, help me!  Somebody, help!!  He's trying to kill me!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are TRAVELING toward the large sign and arrow pointing left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy stares at the sign and the approaching turnoff.  He glances up in his rear-view mirror again.  Biting his lip decides to go for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy's pickup makes a sudden left turn and heads up the toward the cemetery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exploding) Fuckin' A, what'd I tell ya!... (to deputy) ...Hit the noise and cherries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick turns on the siren and the red lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police car SCREECHES left and roars after Tommy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy gets nervous hearing the siren BLARING, but instead pulling over, he speeds up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (vengeful) I'm getting real tired of this maniac.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we better call that psychiatric clinic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (coldly) Better call an ambulance first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sheriff's car accelerates and gains on the pickup.  T high-speed chase continues down the narrow dirt road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy's old pickup SKIDS to a stop in front of the open gates.  He leaps out of the truck as the sheriff SCREECHE next to him.  We CRANE UP past the "Eternal Rest" sign as Tommy races into the old cemetery.  The sheriff and his deputy are running close behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: sprints across the bone yard in the direction of Jason's grave.  In his eyes there is now the hope that they'll se he's telling the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We HEAD toward where Jason's open grave was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He squints his eyes.  Maybe he's in the wrong area.  He s down to look around.  TOMMY IS VIOLENTLY TACKLED BY THE SHERIFF.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angry and out of breath, the sheriff pins him down to cuf him.  Tommy struggles to get up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta show you Jason's grave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (clenching his teeth) I've seen it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (desperate) Please, Sheriff.  You'll see we dug it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally handcuffing him, the sheriff yanks him to his fee Gripping Tommy's arm with one hand, he points at somethin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastically) Well, he must've got chilly in the night and pulled the dirt back over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy looks around to where the sheriff is pointing.  The is astounded by what he sees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About twelve yards away are Jason's and his mother's tombstones.  From this distance, it is impossible to tell that the chunks of lawn over Jason's grave have been repl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy shakes his head in utter disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not right.  Somebody covered it up... (going toward it) ...I gotta see it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sheriff yanks him back.  The deputy pulls his .357 revolver with a laser scope attached.  He aims at Tommy's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very icy) Now see what you've done.  You've made my deputy draw his revolver. That could be a serious headache for you.  He's been dyin' to try out his new mail-order laser scope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The deputy presses his gun's grip.  Instantly a tiny, bri red beam appears on Tommy's temple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a damn impressive piece of high-tech weaponry... Wherever the red dot goes... a bullet is sure to follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stares, fearing for his life, at the stolid deputy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the problem, Sheriff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The old caretaker rushes awkwardly toward them.  Immediat the sheriff whips Tommy around.  He drags him back toward car as Rick quickly holsters his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing, Martin.  Just a vagrant kid.  We got it under control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they leave, Tommy looks back at the old man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (demanding) Who covered up Jason's grave?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin stops abruptly and tries to hide his nervousness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What!?  What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sheriff pulls Tommy along even faster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't concern yourself, Martin. This boy needs treatment.  We're taking care of it.  Sorry for the disturbance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming) Jason's not in his coffin!  Hawes is!  Dig it up!  You gotta dig it up!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He watches with extreme uneasiness as Tommy is thrown int the back of the squad car.  The deputy gets into Tommy's pickup and follows the sheriff's car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pulling out his near-empty bottle of Jack Daniel's, he do it all.  With a noisy exhale, Martin glances back at Jaso grave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mumbles to self) Dig it up?... (he snickers) ...Hell, what kinda butt-hole does he think I am!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As we TIGHTEN in, the large chunks of rearranged lawn are visible.  We HOLD on Jason's tombstone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large group of cheering female youngsters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The little girls sit on two large picnic tables.  Megan stands before them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...And then after that we'll swim, hike, and have lots of fun together.  Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The youngsters squeal even louder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sissy mimes sticking her finger down her throat in disgus Paula stifles a laugh and slaps Sissy's knee.  She looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So where's Cort gone off to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you ready?  He's taken our young men off to teach them my favorites sport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smirking) Which is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sexily) Boy scouting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) You gotta be kidding!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastically) You gotta be kidding!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cort is kneeling on the path, positioning two rocks.  He' surrounded by a group of bored, arms-folded, pre-teen boy

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying hard) No, seriously... the Indian scout would arrange the rocks in such a way that like only his fellow Indians would know.  You know, which way he went... (no response) ...You know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: leans into another equally bored youngster, BILLY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If this is as exciting as it gets, we're in big trouble, dude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JASON STALKS THROUGH THE BLACKENED WOODS.  He heads towar us, wearing a commando belt displaying a knife and devil darts, a bloody machete in his hand.  This undead killing machine keeps coming.  There's a slight fog moving in as night approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off on the side of the road, Sheriff Garris opens his backseat door.  He pulls Tommy out of the vehicle.  Gruff he turns him around and uncuffs him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whipping him back around, the Sheriff grabs him by his sh and pulls him uncomfortably close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
