dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHACK!  The machete blade cuts the phone cord in half.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stares at his handiwork, then heads towards the lit an open window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paula has fallen asleep on her bed.  The phone is right n to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is wearing headphones, listening to her Walkman.  She sit her bed, ogling through the pages of a "PLAYGIRL" magazin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The magazine is filled with beefcake-posing guys.  She is practically drooling on the pages.  In the background, a figure quickly passes by the open window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The movement catches her eye.  She cranes her head to loo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taking off the ROCK 'N' ROLL BLARING headphones, Sissy sh off her Walkman.  She walks over to the window and looks

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sissy, framed by the open window, surveys the area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All is still and motionless in the campgrounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bit perplexed.  She knows she saw something.  She start turn away, when the SOUND of LEAVES CRUNCHING underfoot i HEARD.  She sticks her head out the window.  She tries to sound authoritative.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, who's out there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: stirs and awakens halfway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sleepily) What's goin' on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a bit nervous) I think somebody's messin' around out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paula smirks, rolls over, and closes her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's gotta be Cort.  He loves to scare people... (falling asleep) ...Teach him a lesson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She HEARS FOOTSTEPS right below the window.  She thinks, breaks into an impish grin, seeing something.  Sissy quie tiptoes over to the table and picks up her half-consumed of "Cherry Coke."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sissy, trying not to laugh, sneaks back to the window.  S crouches down, then extends the can outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her hands turn it over and sticky "Cherry Coke" pours dow her victim.  We HEAR IT HITTING SOMEONE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quickly she withdraws the can and jumps back from the win Expecting a response, she is surprised not to get one. Stifling a laugh, she creeps back toward the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tension mounts as she reaches the frame and tentatively p over it.  SHOCKINGLY, JASON SPRINGS UP AND GRABS HER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bottom half of Sissy's body is WHIPPED VIOLENTLY OUT THRO THE WINDOW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: just as Sissy's legs fly out through the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (groggy) Hey, you guys.  Try got to wake the kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paula listens.  She HEARS a STRUGGLE, a WHOOSH, a THUMP, SILENCE.  She snickers once again, then falls back into dreamland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Megan's orange Camaro SCREECHES UP.  We FOLLOW as she jum out and is met by Tommy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (adamantly) I'm gonna borrow your car.  You can't do this with me.  It's much too dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks past him at his pickup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you can't leave that truck out in plain sight.  Talk about dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy turns around to look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hide it behind the gas station. Then we can get the hell out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns back to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (irritated) Look, this isn't a game.  You're not going with me.  I'm already responsible for causing the death of...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Megan cuts him off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quickly) Didn't you say you needed some supplies to do this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh...yes.  But...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (firmly) Then let's get goin'.  We can argue on the way.  You tell me what you need... (with a sly smile) ...I'll make sure you get in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She heads toward her LOUDLY PURRING Camaro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...And nobody drives this baby but me... (pointing) ...Now get that pickup hid and let's boog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There isn't much he can say.  With an exasperated sigh, h runs to move his truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SLOWLY we TRACK along a row of sleeping children.  Each h her own unique position of slumber.  We PULL BACK to reve her large windows just above them beaming in moonlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We FOLLOW Jason's evil shadow as it crosses more sleeping kids.  When it falls across little Nancy, her half-open e flash open!  She sits up in wide-eyed fear as we rapidly PRESS IN on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Megan's hot Camaro jets down the road, kickin' up dust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy shoots Megan a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dryly) Can this tub go any faster?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She returns a flirtatious grin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (self-assured) You got it.  Just keep an eye out for roadblocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking ahead; deadpan) Okay.  There's one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they round the bend, two police cars with lights a- flashin' are blocking the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Megan's car SKIDS to a stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy looks at the temperature Megan for a plan.  She delivers.  Grabbing his head, she pulls it down onto her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (forcefully) Get down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stares bug-eyed as he confronts her tight-jeaned crotc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She slams it into reverse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The orange bomber ROARS backwards down the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: spring into action and give chase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pappas, the very good-looking one of the two officers see earlier, calls it in!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) Unit 45, Officer Pappas to Sheriff Garris.  Do you copy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The distressed sheriff answers the call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) Yeah, I'm here.  What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over radio) Got a different vehicle that just turned tail seeing us.  Saw somebody duck down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got a description or plates?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole enchilada.  It's an '82 orange Camaro, license...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Megan's car back quickly into a turnoff, then PEELS OUT f steam ahead!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer Pappas is just finishing the vehicle's descriptio when the sheriff explodes:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over radio) Son of a shittin' bitch!  That's my daughter's car!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervous) How should we proceed, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beside himself emotionally) With extreme car, for God's sake. If that kid is with her, there's every good chance he'll do something crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Megan) Please don't do anything crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She drives like a hellcat trying to lose the pursuing cop

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what I'm doing.  I got your supplies for ya, didn't I?... Now if I can get to Cunningham Road, I can lose them... (Tommy starts to sit up) ...Just stay where you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts his head back down and stares at the view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deadpan) Whatever you say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Megan's car ROARS by, immediately followed by the two pol cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Headlights illuminate the windy path we TRAVEL.  Enormous trees stand dangerously close to the curved road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our strong-willed heroine is determined to reach her destination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Camaro fires past us.  One cop car, then the other, follow suit.  All three vehicles' tires SQUEAL on the hazardous curves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Megan's wild driving causes his head to roll around in he lap.  He tries to be discreet about where it keeps landin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy registers surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What she sees ahead has her beaming with confidence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two signposts are seen.  One reads "Cunningham Road," the other "Camp Forest Green" with an arrow pointing right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is gonna be a hairy turn. Grab ahold of something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks up at her with a look of "you gotta be kidding."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her car SCREAMS around the turn onto Cunningham Road.

dialogues.speaker: SHOCKINGLY, HER FATHER AND HIS CAR ARE WAITING IN THE DAR
dialogues.text: FOR THEM.  The deputy and his car are right behind the sheriff.  Both have their rifles aimed and ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Megan's car barely has enough room to brake.  The Camaro fishtails to a stop.  The sheriff remains stock-still, no flinching at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a deadly cool, her orders his daughter:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Megan, step out of the car!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stares in horror at her father.  She's never seen him point a gun at her.  But then again she's never pulled a stunt like this.  Megan then looks down at her feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is sprawled across the floorboard, his face between Megan's feet.  He stares at her in utter dread.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking his head) It's just beginning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We HEAD across the campgrounds toward the counselors' cab Climbing the steps, we slowly open the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paula is sound asleep.  The SOUND of the DOOR OPENING cau her to stir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We CONTINUE through the door into the cabin.  Looking aro we spot the sleeping counselor.  We HEAD for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tension builds as we stare at the restless girl.  Sensing someone over her, Paula opens her eyes.  She gasps!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bloody machete is held out before us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little Nancy stands over Paula, holding the machete.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't sleep, Paula.  I'm scared. I saw someone at the window and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paula sits up quickly and grabs the disgusting machete.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Where'd you get this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing) I found it outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paula doesn't know what to think.  Looking around the cab and not seeing anyone, she draws some rapid conclusions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to sound comforting) You know what?  Sissy and Cort are playing jokes.  You know, trying to scare each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (innocently) Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, grown-ups think it's funny to be scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused) Are they grown-ups?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's debatable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (more confused) Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paula shakes her head, puts the machete down on the floor and stands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never mind... (looks at watch) ...Is it that lake already?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grabs the phone and starts to dial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe no one called back.  I better...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who ya calling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: realizes the child doesn't need to hear this conversation She hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't we first try and find Sissy and Cort, then you can go to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes Nancy's hand and they head for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (worried) But what if they try and scare us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (playfully) We'll scare 'em right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy giggles with delight.  They exit the cabin door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paula leads Nancy down the steps.  She makes a game out o quietly sneaking around, looking for the missing counselo For the child, this is fun.

dialogues.speaker: WITHOUT WARNING, JASON'S MASKED FACE IS BEFORE US. A STI
dialogues.text: accompanies this SHOCK CUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the dark shadows, Jason watches the two giggling girls He waits for his moment.  For Jason, this is fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (adamantly) ...And I said, shut up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (just as adamant) All he's asking is for you to check it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pleading) You got me where you want me. There's no reason not...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (restraining his rage) If I had you where I really wanted you, they'd be pumping your ass full of formaldehyde.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't you at least call the camp and make sure everything's all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snapping at her) We have!  Trying to track you down.  The phone there is disconnected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't that tell you something?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...They should've paid their bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the background we HEAR a CALL coming in on the radio. Deputy Colone is HEARD answering it.  The sheriff points Tommy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (icy hatred) You just sit tight, Jason.  Once the authorities from Carpenter get here, you'll...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting; urgent) Sheriff, you better take this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We TRACK with the sheriff over to the deputy on the radio headset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking the call) Sheriff Garris... (as he listens, he reacts to the horrible news) ...Approximately what time? (he glares in Tommy's direction) ...I'll be right there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We FOLLOW the sheriff as he grabs his coat and hat to lea Megan runs up to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?...What happened?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her father looks past her to his deputy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (coldly) Rick.  Keep and eye on our wacko kid.  I'll be back as soon as I can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (insistent) Daddy, what is going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Rick) And make sure my daughter stays put... (looking at Megan) ...She's grounded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Megan steps in his path as he turns to go.  She pushes against his chest as hard as she can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exploding) Tell me!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sheriff immediately raises his hand to strike her.  T quickly controlling himself, he grabs her by the shoulder

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (clenching teeth) They just found your friend Cort and some girl.  She was brutally strangled, and Cort...he had a knife rammed through his skull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Megan shakes her head in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  No, it's not...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Megan.  Tommy Jarvis is a killer.  A very deranged boy who wants you to believe that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason did do it.  I swear! Sheriff, when were they murdered?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He disregards Tommy's question and stares at his daughter with sincere concern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For God's sake, stat away from him.  Please, Meggie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he starts again to leave, Megan, still in shock from t news, grabs her father's arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (intensely) Dad...What time were they murdered?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sheriff hesitates, not wanting to answer.  Somehow it blurts out:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They think somewhere around 8:30 or 9:00.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: steps right up to her father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was with Tommy all that time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This obviously hits him on more than one level.  He masks reaction, turns, and heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick, I'll call you when I get there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He exits and slams the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: with sorrowful eyes, looks back at Tommy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: slams both fists against the bars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paula and Nancy are tiptoeing, trying not to awaken the o children.  Reaching little Nancy's bed, Paula tucks her i snugly.  She crouches next to the child.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering) I'm sure Cort and Sissy are back in their cabins.  So you just go back to sleep and don't worry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what I get scared again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering) Shhh...You know what I used to do when I was a little girl when I got scared?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy shakes her head timidly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering) I would close my eyes and say a little prayer.  And pretty soon, you know what?  Everything scary went away... (reassuringly) ...It worked for me.  I'll bet it'll work for you too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She kisses the child's forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lovingly) Good night.  See ya in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she stands up, we see JASON GLARING AT THEM THROUGH TH WINDOW.  Paula smiles tenderly at Nancy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy smiles back at her, rolls over, and closes her eyes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She begins to quietly head for the door.  JASON FOLLOWS R ALONG OUTSIDE FROM WINDOW TO WINDOW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paula exits the dormitory door as silently as possible. looks around the area, still very concerned about her companions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gently breeze is blowing away the evening fog.  The tre and brushes seem to shiver nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as she slowly descends the steps.  Somehow she can sense deadly face.  Paula looks around again, then hurries towa her cabin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paula races across the camp to the counselor's cabin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She rushes up the cabin steps and finds the door closed. seems relieved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sissy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Paula enters, she is disappointed to find it empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hurries to the phone and starts dialing.  For the fir time, she realizes the phone is dead.  Her frustration tu to alarm when she notices something at her feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: hears a NOISE and turns to look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It moves a bit.  Was it the wind or is someone behind it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not sure if it's a joke or her imagination, Paula slowly heads towards it.  Tension mounts.  Just as she reaches i she slowly extends her hand to grab the knob.  SUDDENLY, WIND BLOWS IT TOWARD HER.  She backs up.  It slams shut. one, of course, is there.  She giggles at herself and reo the door.  JASON IS RIGHT THERE IN THE DOORWAY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few yards from the cabin, we watch as Jason quickly lun at Paula and SLAMS the door, MUFFLING her SCREAM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deputy Colone is hunched over his desk, doing what he hat most...filling out reports.  He glances up at Tommy, then over at Megan.  Satisfied, he returns to his shitwork.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seated across the room, she appears to be idly sketching something on a large pad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: sits on his jail cot, head in hands, hopeless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: looks up at the deputy, then over at Tommy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He glances up at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She holds up the sketch pad for him to read.  As she does his eyes widen, amazed at what she's written.  He mouths you sure?" as she lowers the pad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods a strong affirmative.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy gets up off his cot and stretches nonchalantly.  He eyes the deputy, then Megan.  She flips a page over, and starts to really sketch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what are ya drawin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's it to ya?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: looks up, irritated by the noise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, pipe down, Jarvis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: grabs the cell bars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just curious about what she was drawin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: holds it up for Tommy to see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) There...Ya happy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Cause it stinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Megan throws the sketch pad at him.  It bounces off the b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches down, grabs it, and pulls it into his cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: stands up defiantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, give it back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slyly) Come and get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is really getting him pissed.  He gets up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bastard...Megan, I'll get in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is already in front of the wall.  She reaches through the bars for the pad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give it to me, punk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly he grabs her arm, pulls her to the bars, and sta kissing her passionately.  The more she struggles, the tighter he envelopes her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He races across the room.  Awkwardly, he grapples to sepa them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they battle, Megan's hand secretly reaches down and pu the gun from the deputy's holster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Megan allows herself to be torn from Tommy's embrace.  Th angry deputy reaches at Tommy, who backs away into the ce

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stinkin' maggot, I oughta...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (demanding) Let him out of there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he turns to face Megan, a red laser dot appears on the of his nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Megan points the laser-scoped revolver right at us.  She definitely means business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He chuckles in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Megan, don't clown around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: holds the gun dead-steady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't the one with the funny red nose...Open the cell and exchange places...with him... (she cocks the trigger) ...Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boy moves up behind him and reinforces the seriousnes the situation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (enjoying this) Better do as she says, 'cause ...wherever the red dot goes, a bullet is sure to follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The deputy reluctantly removes his keys and turns toward Tommy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (furiously) You brainwashed her, you sonofabitch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: breaks into a cocky smile, and answers for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, something like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy and Megan fly out the door and race toward the Cama

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got the keys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: reaches under the car and quickly withdraws a tiny box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, he took 'em...But I got my Hide-a-Key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: rushes up and grabs it from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Megan.  Not this time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pissed) Wait a minute. I just...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (determined) I thank you for getting me out. But I gotta finish what I started.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: stares defiantly at him as she opens the driver's door an gets in.  She suddenly slides over to the passenger's sea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, come on, hot lips, let's go. You drive, I'll navigate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy throws up his hands, then climbs in.  The car start and ROARS down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JASON PATROLS THE CHILDREN'S CABIN.  Slowly and menacingl he walks by the sleeping youngsters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slumbering soundly, they have no awareness of the monster the edge of their beds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: reaches the end of the dormitory.  With his back to us, h stops, senses something, and whips around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He glares at someone with evil intent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The terrified child's eyes peek from under the sheet.  Sh ain't dreaming.  This monster is real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason stands and stares at Nancy at the other end of the cabin.  He then stalks her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another patrol car, with Officer Pappas and Thornton, pul up behind it.  The wind is getting stronger as it whips through the trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The child is frozen in pure terror.  She can't even cry o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly, Jason's masked face descends toward us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The child squeezes her eyes shut and begins to pray, very quickly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whimpering) Now I lay me down to sleep, I pray the Lord my soul to keep...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (voice quavering) ...If I should die before I wake, I pray the Lord my soul to take. Now I lay me... etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason HEARS the CAR DOOR SLAM outside.  His face turns to the noise.  He immediately heads for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With her eyes still tightly shut, she continues to pray, unaware that her monster has gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheriff Garris surveys the campgrounds suspiciously.  The officers approach him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's the story here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you boys nose around. I gotta go break the news to Megan's friends about what's happened.  Holler if you see anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: heads for the lit counselor's cabin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything that don't belong.  And don't wake the kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two officers take out their flashlights.  They spread and scan the area.  The RAGING wind causes everything to WHISTLE and move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KNOCKING is HEARD on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Girls?  It's Sheriff Garris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly he opens the door and sticks his head in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is horrified!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire room is SPLATTERED WITH BLOOD.  It drips from ceiling and streaks down the walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quickly, he bolts out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sheriff races down the steps and heads for the childr dormitories.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer Thornton's flashlight scans the two boats along t small dock.  Nothing unusual here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Although we can't see anyone in the WIND-RUSTLED bushes, sense Jason is watching the lone cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His hand withdraws a long, razor-sharp devil dart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With his back to us, the unsuspecting cop concludes his search of the landing and turns around.  His flashlight n focuses on the woods before him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We FOLLOW the flashlight beam as it surveys the windswept area.  JASON IS ILLUMINATED!  He raises up the sinister d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Recognizing a weapon in this prowler's hand, he goes for revolver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With supernatural strength, he throws the deadly projecti at us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before he can pull his gun, THE DEVIL IMPALES ITSELF DEEP INTO HIS FOREHEAD.  The force of it sends him reeling bac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer Thornton's body falls into it.  His lifeless eyes stare up at the sky.  The dart extends from his third eye

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A row of sleeping boys stacking Z's in their cots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing in the doorway, the sheriff quietly closes the d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The panicked sheriff now rushes across to the girls' dorm

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As silently as possible, he opens the door and peeks it. carefully surveys all the slumbering occupants.  The sher suddenly registers alarm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the girls are nestled contentedly in their beds...exc one.  The covers have been kicked off and her pillow lies the floor.  Little Nancy is missing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The orange speed-demon Camaro rockets past us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Megan, sitting shotgun, stares open-mouthed at Tommy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastically) Let me know when you're about to blast into hyperspace.  I'll fasten my seat belt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: drives like a man possessed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a bad feeling we're already too late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Megan glances back at the large sack in the rear seat.  S reaches over and looks in at his supplies doubtfully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure this is gonna work? I mean, why didn't we bring that gun and just blast him away?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It probably wouldn't have any effect on him.  The only sure way to stop Jason is to return him to his original resting place, where he drowned in 1957.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lake Forest Green?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods, then corrects her) Crystal Lake...where the nightmare began.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The infamous lake is churning in the moonlight.  RACK FOC as Officer Pappas steps before us.  It's apparent that he getting tired of searching for God-knows-what.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His flashlight scans the windblown, vibrating bushes. Suddenly, FOOTSTEPS are HEARD on the other side of the bu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops abruptly and strains to listen.  Tentatively, he creeps toward the bushes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We HEAD toward whatever is hiding behind the trembling shrubbery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reaching the brushes, he calls out:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, come out of there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No reply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He draws his revolver and aims it.  He knows someone's th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm askin' you one more time ...come out of there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still no response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With his gun held before him, the nervous officer goes fo closer look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tension builds as he comes closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is almost to the bushes.  WITHOUT WARNING, SOMEONE DIV BEFORE US AND ATTACKS HIS LEG.  He gasps aloud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The frightened child holds on to Pappas for dear life.  H catches his breath, then crouches down next to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (kindly) Hey, hey, what are you doing running around out here?  Now you get back to bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She squeezes his leg even tighter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (terrified) No.  There's a scary man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The good-looking officer smiles with amusement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What scary man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly Jason is before him.  His powerful hand reaches and grabs the officer's SCREAMING face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is thrown open.  The sheriff reaches in and quickly pulls his shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leaving the door open, he sprints across the camp towards gunshots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he rounds the corner of a cabin, Nancy comes SCREECHIN toward him.  He catches the child and attempts to comfort

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on.  Take it easy.  I got you.  Everything is fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he hugs her, he looks up at the boys' dormitory cabin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the children are pressed against the windows, staring down terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quickly, the sheriff picks Nancy up and heads for the cab

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheriff Garris bursts into the cabin.  All the girls have gathered in the boys' cabin for safety.  He puts little N down and addresses the petrified youngsters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kids, listen to me very carefully. I want everyone to lie down on the floor and stay there.  Do not get up until I come back.  Now hurry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some cover their heads, others crawl under the cots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sheriff runs out of the children's cabin, securing th door behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pumps the weapon as he walks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With stern vigilance, he storms toward his objective.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: arrives in the area behind the cabins near the lake.  The is no one to be found.  The savage wind whips the trees a bushes, causing the sheriff to twitch at every movement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly, he turns and heads into the shadowed area between cabins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the shotgun held before him, he walks tensely throug this dark passage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sheriff's eyes dart nervously, straining to see in th near blackness.  Suddenly, he trips and falls from view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rapidly, we TILT DOWN as he slams down on Officer Pappas' corpse.

dialogues.speaker: THE SHERIFF'S FACE LANDS PRESSED AGAINST THE GROTESQUE BL
dialogues.text: SKULL.  Horribly repulsed, he scrambles to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: stands up, turns, and JASON IS WAITING RIGHT THERE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quickly, he backs away from this masked spectre of evil. Then they both stands motionless for a long time, sizing other up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He decides to make the first move.  He lunges forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Instantly, he raises the shotgun and BLASTS Jason with bo barrels!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hole is ripped out of Jason's side!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shocked beyond belief, the sheriff drops the rifle and pu out his .357.  Backing up, he empties the chamber into th stalking ghoul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he advances on the firing sheriff, we see THE BULLETS EXITING FROM JASON'S BACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All this is only making him madder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His gun CLICKING empty, he has but one option left.  He t it.  The sheriff turns and runs like hell toward the wood JASON IS RIGHT BEHIND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Megan's Camaro roars into the campsite next to the police cars.  Megan jumps out and looks around for her father. Tommy grabs the heavy sack from the back seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excited; pointing at cars) They did show up.  Isn't that great?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (worried) I hope so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: sees the lights on in the counselors' cabin.  She rushes toward it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Megan, wait!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Megan dashes up the steps and throws the door open.  She SCREAMS in horror at the blood-spattered room.  She turns runs toward the dormitories.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad!...Daddy!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: lugging the heavy sack, chases after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Megan!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the violently windblown forest dashes our "former macho" sheriff.  Primal instincts tell him only one thing save your own ass.  He runs for his life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: continues his pursuit of the lawman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Megan BURSTS in through the door!  All the kids SCREAM. quickly scans the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Petrified little faces stare up at her from the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hurries into the cabin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay.  It's me--Megan.  Don't be afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: run over and hug her for security.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to sound calm) It's all right.  Shhh-hh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy looks in and is relieved to see they're all right. quickly turns and runs back down the steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy races from the campsite toward the dock, lugging th heavy satchel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reaching the landing, he starts to board one of the two b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He recoils in horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The murdered cop, Officer Thornton, lies in the rowboat. dead eyes glare right at us.  Blood flows from the impale dart in his forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He immediately goes for another boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unfortunately, this one is older and more rickety, eviden when Tommy steps into it and it SQUEAKS and MOANS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Opening it up, Tommy pulls out a long and very heavy chai He then withdraws some huge padlocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With intense urgency, he looks along the lake shore for something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, they stop, turn, and retrace their steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seems he has lost his prey.  Carefully, he searches the RUSTLING bushes for the hiding sheriff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buried deep in the thick bushes, the winded sheriff holds breath as Jason passes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Megan has done her best to assure the children that they safe.  She stands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I gotta find my daddy, the sheriff, so we can all go home. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids nod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: heads for the door.  She turns to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you stay here and we'll be back to get you.  Everyone lie back down and don't worry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The 12-year-old youngsters seen earlier.  Billy turns to sarcastic friend Tyen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (scared) What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we're dead meat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy struggles to roll a large, heavy rock toward the bo In the background, Megan is running around the campsite CALLING OUT for her father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Already fearing the worst, he yells to Megan:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Megan!  Use your dad's car radio and call for assistance...and an ambulance!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stares at Tommy, petrified at what that means.  She t runs toward the sheriff's car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Megan throws the car door open, SISSY'S HEAD ROLLS OUT LANDS AT HER FEET.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She goes berserk with horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming) Oh, God!  Oh my God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Megan looks around, terrified that this same fate has befallen her father.  She SCREAMS OUT even LOUDER:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad!  Answer me!  Daddy, where are you!  Help us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lying on the floor, Tyen looks at Billy with a what-did-I tell-ya' attitude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (scared) Real dead meat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks up, HEARING his daughter's distant CRY.  What ca do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops his search.  He HEARS Megan as well.  JASON HEAD THE DIRECTION OF MEGAN'S VOICE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sheriff peeks out of his hiding place.  Our killer st by without seeing him.  Jason is hell-bent for Megan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seeing Jason heading towards his daughter, his protective fatherly instincts cause him to take action without thoug He leaps out at Jason!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  Not her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With almost superhuman strength, the sheriff attacks Jaso and starts pounding him into the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So aggressive and relentless is the pummeling, for a mome you think he might kill the monster.  But only for a mome

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only disoriented and not at all hurt, Jason rolls over un the sheriff.  He grasps the sheriff's arm, stopping the assault.

dialogues.speaker: JASON SHOCKINGLY TEARS THE SHERIFF'S ARMS OUT OF THEIR
dialogues.text: SOCKETS.  He throws them aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he is forced back toward his feet, a horrid CRACK is HEARD.  HIS SPINE HAS BEEN SNAPPED IN HALF.  His body collapses backwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enraged, Jason throws the rag doll-like body of the sheri aside as he rises.  Megan's VOICE is HEARD again, calling the father.  JASON HEADS FOR HER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Megan is struggling to help Tommy get the huge rock into boat.  Her eyes are watering from fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta help me look for him...We need him to help us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chains are arranged to go around the rock.  Tommy tri to brace himself as they lower the boulder down.  A CRACK HEARD as the huge stone lands in the old wooden boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exhausted) Whew...Okay, hand me those padlocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (near hysteria) Did you hear me?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impatiently) Yes.  And I said, hand me those padlocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grabs the locks and gives them to him angrily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna be sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: starts padlocking the chains tightly around the rock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy straightens out the rest of the heavy chain.  He fashions a noose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: paces the dock in nervous fear.  She doesn't know what to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy unties the boat and pushes off the dock into the churning water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Megan!  Get back into the cabin with the kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: keeps pacing and looking around nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Megan, please!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly it dawns on her that he's actually leaving her a out here.  She panics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Don't leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts rowing out into the lake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (adamant) Megan, get in there with them before it's too late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's too late...JASON EXPLODES THROUGH THE DOOR, KNOCKING OFF ITS HINGES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: run SCREAMING to the back of the cabin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She races from the landing toward the cabin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy watches, helpless.  He stands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Megan!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Megan is only a few yards from the cabin.  WITHOUT WARNIN JASON BURSTS OUT THROUGH A WINDOW AND LANDS BEFORE HER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He springs up and grabs the stunned Megan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she SCREAMS, Jason's hand grips her face.  She is abou share the same horrific fate as Officer Pappas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JASON!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks over toward the lake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out on the lake, Tommy is seen awkwardly standing in the boat, waving his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Jason!  It's me you want! Come and get me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He suddenly tosses Megan aside and heads for Tommy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: falls on the ground, trembling and hyperventilating.  She stares at the departing Jason and looks back at the cabin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the eyes of the petrified kids peek down at her from bottom of the window frames.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy keeps taunting Jason to come for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it!  Come on, pus-head!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason reaches the lake and keeps going as if the water di even exist.  He stays fixed on the one thing he's wanted kill the most...Tommy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seeing he's got him, Tommy sits down.  He reaches for the chain noose and holds it in his sweating hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason is wading deeper into the dark, choppy waters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seeing Jason is getting dangerously close to Tommy, Megan jumps up and starts yelling:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy, get out of there!  Row to the other side of the lake! Hurry!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason stops and turns back to look at Megan.  Should he g her first?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He panics and yells at Jason:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, asshole!  It's me you want, remember?!  Come on, chickhenshit, I'm sittin' here waitin'!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: turns back towards the boy.  He moves on him like a hungr shark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy's nervous hands keep the noose out of Jason's sight he opens it wider.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is almost to the boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is sweating profusely as he grits his teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boy goes crazy, looking from one side to the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He scans the sinister, churning waters.  Where will Jason emerge?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long, tense wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bubbles rise.  Tommy holds the noose over him.  JASON EXPLODES UP FROM THE OTHER SIDE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy loses his balance and drops the noose into the bott of the boat.  His fall causes the rickety boat to CRACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water starts to leak in around the huge rock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: grabs for Tommy, who struggles to reach the noose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Megan is freaking out, not knowing what to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JASON'S HAND GRABS TOMMY'S JACKET.  The boy fights to bre free of his grip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their struggle causes it to split open wide.  More water pours in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tries to snag the noose as Jason pulls harder on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: yanks his arm away violently, causing his sleeve to rip o in Jason's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He manages to catch to noose with his shoe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boat is filling up with water around the rock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: grabs ahold of Tommy's leg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: slides the chain up to his outstretched fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boy grabs the noose and forces it over Jason's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enraged, he lunges at Tommy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all that's needed to split open the hull!  JASON I PULLED UNDER AND HE DRAGS TOMMY DOWN WITH HIM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The large boulder falls to the bottom of the lake.  Its c pulls taut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chain noose tightens around Jason's neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason struggles to hold on to Tommy while trying to loose the choke-chain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He fights to free himself of Jason's grasp before running of breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gives up on the noose, opting to strange Tommy instead Both are drowning in this battle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
